answerText: "In Praise of Limestone"[10] The speaker of this poem warns "we must love one another or die" because "defenseless under the night / our world in stupor lies" as people are described going about their everyday lives on the title date.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 2 | 1 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: ) This poem muses about the best and worst of mankind and their depictions. For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem whose speaker prefers "modifications of matter into / innocent athletes and gesticulating fountains" made of the title substance.
